shortDefinition: A text-based interface for interacting with your computer through commands.
longDefinition: The terminal (also called command line, console, or shell) is a text-based interface that lets you interact with your computer by typing commands. While it may seem intimidating at first, the terminal is incredibly powerful and often faster than graphical interfaces for many tasks. It's essential for system administration, development, and automation. The terminal runs a shell program (like Bash or Zsh) that interprets your commands.
examples: Open terminal with Ctrl+Alt+T on Ubuntu
ls - list files in current directory
cd Documents - change to Documents folder

seo.title: What is the Linux Terminal? | Command Line Explained
seo.description: Learn what the Linux terminal is and how to use it. Basic commands, why the command line is powerful, and getting started guide.
